strategy_reasoning: Adopting the 'RPG Inventory Upgrade' strategy mentioned in the updates. By visualizing technical changes (OpenClaw search, UI fixes) as game items and quest logs, we make the dev-log feel like a fun patch note drop. The cozy pixel art softens the technical nature of API configurations.

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of the Pollinations bee mascot holding a glowing magical robotic claw (OpenClaw) that is projecting a holographic search window. The hologram shows pixelated web icons (globe, magnifying glass). Background is a soft lime green (#ecf874) and lavender gradient. Chunky retro sprites, warm lighting like Stardew Valley. Text in pixel font: 'OPENCLAW: WEB SEARCH UNLOCKED'. Nostalgic, magical tech vibes.
images.description: Announces the major feature: OpenClaw can now search the web using Gemini and Perplexity.

images.prompt: A retro RPG-style inventory or quest menu screen displayed on a cozy CRT monitor. The screen shows a clean 'Tabbed UI' layout with a connection cable plugged in. Pixel art style like the game Unpacking. Soft pastel colors, peach and mint, with lime green (#ecf874) highlights on the buttons. A tiny pixel dev character is giving a thumbs up. Text in pixel font: 'UI LEVEL UP +10 CLARITY'. Warm, clean, satisfying.
images.description: Visualizes the Landing Page and UI cleanup as an inventory organization upgrade.

images.prompt: A cute pixel art sleeping animation. A cookie character (representing 'nomnom' model) is tucking itself into a cozy digital treasure chest to sleep. 'Zzz' pixel particles floating up. Background is warm cream and lime green (#ecf874). Soft lighting, peaceful vibes. Text in pixel font: 'BRB NAPPING'.
images.description: Friendly way to announce the temporary disabling of the nomnom model without sounding like an error.
